      • A project update on growing the Haskell userbase through mentorship.
      • A podcast with Michael Snoyman discusses newcomer friendliness, STM, and laziness.
      • Well-Typed talk recordings from ZuriHac 2025 are now available.
    • Development Techniques:
      • Applying Type-Driven Development principles to Domain-Driven Design.
      • Using an interning cache to reduce memory residency and improve CPU performance.
      • A technique for type inference for plain data structures like JSON/YAML.
      • Using Template Haskell to simulate structural subtyping.
      • A code-transformation technique using traversals to batch database queries, yielding 100x-300x performance improvements.
  • Jobs:
    • Bellroy is hiring a Haskell Developer for their e-commerce platform.
  • In Brief:
    • Releases:
      • Aztecs v0.14.0: A modular game engine and Entity Component System (ECS).
      • GHC 9.10.3-rc3 is now available for testing.
    • Tooling:
      • hs-static-bin: A new tool to build Haskell static binaries using ad-hoc Docker containers.
  • Show & Tell:
    • A method for embedding interactive 3D models into Haddock documentation on Hackage.
    • A hasktorch example demonstrating linear regression.
    • A comparison of implementing in-order binary tree traversal in Haskell and Rust.
  • Call for Participation:
    • An RFC proposes introducing a serialisable bytecode format to GHC.
    • A feature request for the horde-ad library to allow user-provided handwritten derivatives.
NGINX Introduces Native Support for ACME Protocol – NGINX Community Blog
nginxacmessltlscertificate managementautomationrustlet's encryptweb securityhttpsdevops
  • NGINX introduces native ACME protocol support via a new Rust-based dynamic module, ngx_http_acme_module.
  • Goal: Automate SSL/TLS certificate issuance, renewal, and management directly within NGINX configuration, reducing reliance on external tools like Certbot.
  • Benefits:
    • Simplified workflow using NGINX directives.
    • Reduced manual errors and operational overhead.
    • Smaller attack surface and fewer external dependencies.
    • Platform-independent solution.
  • Configuration:
    • acme_issuer: Specifies the ACME CA directory URL (e.g., Let's Encrypt).
    • acme_certificate: Enables ACME for a server block, using server_name for identifiers.
    • $acme_certificate & $acme_certificate_key: Variables used to apply the managed certificate and key.
  • Current Limitations (Preview Release):
    • Only the HTTP-01 challenge is supported.
    • Wildcard and regular expression domains are not yet supported as identifiers.
  • Availability: Available for both NGINX Open Source and enterprise NGINX One (Plus) customers.
Debian -- News -- Debian 13 "trixie" released
debiandebian 13trixieoperating systemlinuxreleaseannouncementlong term supportltslinux kernelriscv64i386armelamd64arm64armhfppc64els390xhardware architecturey2038time_topenldapopensslgnutlsreproducible buildspackage managementgccllvmclangglibctoolchainpythonperlphpopenjdkrustrustcpostgresqlmariadbopensshsystemdgnomekde plasmaxfcedesktop environment
  • Release: Debian 13 "trixie"
  • Support: 5-year Long Term Support (LTS).
  • Kernel: Linux 6.12 LTS series.
  • Architectures:
    • Adds official support for riscv64.
    • Drops official support for i386 (no kernel/installer).
    • This is the final release supporting armel.
    • Total of 7 official architectures: amd64, arm64, armel, armhf, ppc64el, riscv64, s390x.
  • Core System:
    • All architectures (except i386) now use a 64-bit time_t ABI, supporting dates beyond Y2038.
    • OpenLDAP client/server now uses OpenSSL for TLS instead of GnuTLS.
    • Focus on reproducible builds, with status verifiable via the debian-repro-status package.
  • Package Statistics:
    • Total Packages: ~69,830
    • New Packages: > 14,100
    • Updated Packages: > 44,326 (over 63% of the previous release).
  • Key Software Versions:
    • Toolchains: GCC 14.2, LLVM/Clang 19 (default), Glibc 2.41
    • Languages/Runtimes: Python 3.13, Perl 5.40, PHP 8.4, OpenJDK 21, Rustc 1.85
    • Services: PostgreSQL 17, MariaDB 11.8, OpenSSH 10.0p1, Systemd 257
    • Desktop Environments: GNOME 48, KDE Plasma 6.3, Xfce 4.20
